revision.comment: Tag and assess for WikiProject United States/Massachusetts using [[Project:AWB|AWB]] (7940)
revision.text: {{Talk header}} {{ArticleHistory |action1=GAN |action1date=14:00, 13 August 2010 |action1link=Talk:USS Massachusetts (BB-2)/GA1 |action1result=listed |action1oldid=378714925 |action2=WAR |action2date=03:10, 20 August 2010 |action2link=Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Assessment/USS Massachusetts (BB-2) |action2result=approved |action2oldid=378879471 |action3=FAC |action3date=18:48, 7 September 2010 |action3link=Wikipedia:Featured article candidates/USS Massachusetts (BB-2)/archive1 |action3result=promoted |action3oldid=383023573 |topic=history |currentstatus=FA }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|collapsed=yes|1= {{WikiProject Ships|class=FA}} {{WPMILHIST|A-Class=pass|class=FA|Maritime=yes|US=yes|WWI=yes|OMT=1}} {{WikiProject United States|class=FA|importance=low|MA=yes|MA-importance=low}} {{WikiProject National Register of Historic Places|class=FA|importance=mid}} {{WikiProject Shipwrecks|importance=low|class=FA}} {{WikiProject Florida|class=FA|importance=Low}} }} == Coordinate error == {{tlc|geodata-check}} The coordinates need the following fixes: * Write here The Bureau of Archaeological Research coordinates for this site are 30° 17’ 48” N, 87° 18’ 41” W [[User:Bureau Underwater|Bureau Underwater]] ([[User talk:Bureau Underwater|talk]]) 17:52, 22 October 2009 (UTC) Done. The coordinates 30° 17.816’ N 87° 18.69’ W published in [http://www.museumsinthesea.com/_docs/Massachusetts_brochure.pdf the Florida Bureau of Archaeological Research brochure on the USS Massachusetts] convert to 30° 17’ 49” N, 87° 18’ 41” W. [[User:BrainMarble|BrainMarble]] ([[User talk:BrainMarble|talk]]) 02:09, 18 December 2009 (UTC) {{Talk:USS Massachusetts (BB-2)/GA1}} == References == References are inconsistent in style: * Some citations use title case, others use sentence case ** {{done}} result of lazy copying on my part [[User:Yoenit|Yoenit]] ([[User talk:Yoenit|talk]]) 16:44, 8 August 2010 (UTC) * Mix between standard footnotes and shortened footnotes ** Not a problem, see [[Wikipedia:Citing_sources#How to present citations]](it even provides some examples of FA's that do the same) [[User:Yoenit|Yoenit]] ([[User talk:Yoenit|talk]]) 16:44, 8 August 2010 (UTC) * Shortened footnotes not formatted in Harvard style; i.e. Reilly & Scheina 1980, p. 58 ** using titles instead of publication dates is allowed (see [[WP:CITESHORT]]) [[User:Yoenit|Yoenit]] ([[User talk:Yoenit|talk]]) 16:44, 8 August 2010 (UTC) :::Works or titles are used only for sources with no author. ---'''''— [[User:Gadget850|Gadget850 (Ed)]] '''''[[User talk:Gadget850|''talk'']] 22:19, 8 August 2010 (UTC) :::: Thats not what [[WP:CITESHORT]] says. I am not aware of any other policies providing rules for shortened footnotes, would you be so kind to link the relevant one? [[User:Yoenit|Yoenit]] ([[User talk:Yoenit|talk]]) 06:34, 9 August 2010 (UTC) :::::Shortened notes are formatted Harvard style— normally as "last year, page". The year can be in parenthesis and the page can be separated with a colon. If there is no author, then work or title is used. See [[Wikipedia:Parenthetical referencing]]. CITESHORT needs work— it is on my list. :::::You can optionally link the short cite to the full cite; see [[Wikipedia:Citing sources/Further considerations]] and for an example, see [[Massachusetts in the American Civil War]]. I think it makes it easier for those not familiar to the system to find the full cite. ---'''''— [[User:Gadget850|Gadget850 (Ed)]] '''''[[User talk:Gadget850|''talk'']] 13:11, 9 August 2010 (UTC) :I don't see this as a showstopper for GA, but it will be an issue for A or FA. ---'''''— [[User:Gadget850|Gadget850 (Ed)]] '''''[[User talk:Gadget850|''talk'']] 16:07, 8 August 2010 (UTC) :: Thanks for your comments, your input at the ongoing A-class review would also be appreciated. [[User:Yoenit|Yoenit]] ([[User talk:Yoenit|talk]]) 16:44, 8 August 2010 (UTC) == Notes == Please see the [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Assessment/USS Massachusetts (BB-2)|A-class review]] for some copyediting notes. - Dank ([[User talk:Dank|push to talk]]) 19:57, 8 August 2010 (UTC)
